meanings.definition: The process of teaching a person or group to accept a set of beliefs uncritically.
meanings.sent1: The school used indoctrination to make all students think the same way.
meanings.sent2: The cult leader used indoctrination to control his followers' thoughts.
meanings.sent3: The comedy skit joked about a robot receiving indoctrination to believe it was a toaster.
meanings.sent4: The indoctrination of fear into society's fabric can lead to widespread paranoia.
meanings.sent5: The vivid imagery in the movie showed the effects of indoctrination on young minds.

meanings.definition: The act of instilling a particular ideology or viewpoint in someone.
meanings.sent1: The political party's indoctrination of its members was evident in their speeches.
meanings.sent2: The company's indoctrination of teamwork values boosted employee morale.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon depicted a superhero using indoctrination to teach villains kindness.
meanings.sent4: The indoctrination of hope in the face of adversity can inspire great change.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's passionate speech highlighted the power of positive indoctrination.
